com.planbase.pdf.layoutmanager.pages

Interface RenderTarget

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    PageGrouping, SinglePage

    public RenderTarget

    Represents something to be drawn to. For page-breaking, use the class PageGrouping implementation. For a fixed, single page use the class SinglePage implementation.

    See Also:
    class PageGrouping, class SinglePage

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  RenderTarget.DefaultImpls
      Represents something to be drawn to. For page-breaking, use the class PageGrouping implementation. For a fixed, single page use the class SinglePage implementation.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      float drawImage(Coord bottomLeft, ScaledImage.WrappedImage wi, boolean reallyRender)
      Puts an image on this RenderTarget @param bottomLeft the Coord of the lower-left-hand corner @param wi the scaled, "wrapped" jpeg/png image @param reallyRender Only render this if true. Otherwise, just measure and return. @return the effective height after page breaking (may include some extra space above to push items onto the next page).
      float drawImage(Coord bottomLeft, ScaledImage.WrappedImage wi)
      Puts an image on this RenderTarget @param bottomLeft the Coord of the lower-left-hand corner @param wi the scaled, "wrapped" jpeg/png image @return the effective height after page breaking (may include some extra space above to push items onto the next page).
      RenderTarget drawLine(Coord start, Coord end, LineStyle lineStyle, boolean reallyRender)
      Draws a line from (x1, y1) to (x2, y2). Direction is important if using mitering.
      RenderTarget drawLine(Coord start, Coord end, LineStyle lineStyle)
      Draws a line from (x1, y1) to (x2, y2). Direction is important if using mitering.
      RenderTarget drawLineStrip(java.util.List<com.planbase.pdf.layoutmanager.utils.Coord> points, LineStyle lineStyle, boolean reallyRender)
      Draws lines from the first point to the last. Direction is important if using mitering.
      RenderTarget drawLineStrip(java.util.List<com.planbase.pdf.layoutmanager.utils.Coord> points, LineStyle lineStyle)
      Draws lines from the first point to the last. Direction is important if using mitering.
      float drawStyledText(Coord baselineLeft, java.lang.String text, TextStyle textStyle, boolean reallyRender)
      Puts styled text on this RenderTarget @param baselineLeft the Coord of the left-hand baseline point. Ascent goes above, descent and leading below. @param text the text @param textStyle the style @param reallyRender Only render this if true. Otherwise, just measure and return. @return the effective height after page breaking (may include some extra space above to push items onto the next page).
      float drawStyledText(Coord baselineLeft, java.lang.String text, TextStyle textStyle)
      Puts styled text on this RenderTarget @param baselineLeft the Coord of the left-hand baseline point. Ascent goes above, descent and leading below. @param text the text @param textStyle the style @return the effective height after page breaking (may include some extra space above to push items onto the next page).
      float fillRect(Coord bottomLeft, Dim dim, org.apache.pdfbox.pdmodel.graphics.color.PDColor c, boolean reallyRender)
      Puts a colored rectangle on this RenderTarget. There is no outline or border (that's drawn separately with textLines). @param bottomLeft the Coord of the lower-left-hand corner @param dim width and height (dim) of rectangle @param c color @param reallyRender Only render this if true. Otherwise, just measure and return. @return the effective height after page breaking (may include some extra space above to push items onto the next page).
      float fillRect(Coord bottomLeft, Dim dim, org.apache.pdfbox.pdmodel.graphics.color.PDColor c)
      Puts a colored rectangle on this RenderTarget. There is no outline or border (that's drawn separately with textLines). @param bottomLeft the Coord of the lower-left-hand corner @param dim width and height (dim) of rectangle @param c color @return the effective height after page breaking (may include some extra space above to push items onto the next page).
      float pageBreakingTopMargin(float bottomY, float height)
      Returns the top margin necessary to push this item onto a new page if it won't fit on this one. If it will fit, simply returns 0.

    • Method Detail

      • drawLine

        RenderTarget drawLine(Coord start,
                      Coord end,
                      LineStyle lineStyle,
                      boolean reallyRender)

        Draws a line from (x1, y1) to (x2, y2). Direction is important if using mitering.

        @param start the Coord of the starting point @param end the Coord of the ending point @param lineStyle the style to draw the line with @param reallyRender Only render this if true. Otherwise, just measure and return. @return the updated RenderTarget (may be changed to return the lowest y-value instead)

      • drawLine

        RenderTarget drawLine(Coord start,
                      Coord end,
                      LineStyle lineStyle)

        Draws a line from (x1, y1) to (x2, y2). Direction is important if using mitering.

        @param start the Coord of the starting point @param end the Coord of the ending point @param lineStyle the style to draw the line with @return the updated RenderTarget (may be changed to return the lowest y-value instead)

      • drawLineStrip

        RenderTarget drawLineStrip(java.util.List<com.planbase.pdf.layoutmanager.utils.Coord> points,
                           LineStyle lineStyle,
                           boolean reallyRender)

        Draws lines from the first point to the last. Direction is important if using mitering.

        @param points the list of Coord to draw lines between. This does not connect the last point to the first. If you want that, add the first point again at the end of the list. @param lineStyle the style to draw the line with @param reallyRender Only render this if true. Otherwise, just measure and return. @return the updated RenderTarget (may be changed to return the lowest y-value instead)

      • drawLineStrip

        RenderTarget drawLineStrip(java.util.List<com.planbase.pdf.layoutmanager.utils.Coord> points,
                           LineStyle lineStyle)

        Draws lines from the first point to the last. Direction is important if using mitering.

        @param points the list of Coord to draw lines between. This does not connect the last point to the first. If you want that, add the first point again at the end of the list. @param lineStyle the style to draw the line with @return the updated RenderTarget (may be changed to return the lowest y-value instead)

      • drawStyledText

        float drawStyledText(Coord baselineLeft,
                     java.lang.String text,
                     TextStyle textStyle,
                     boolean reallyRender)

        Puts styled text on this RenderTarget @param baselineLeft the Coord of the left-hand baseline point. Ascent goes above, descent and leading below. @param text the text @param textStyle the style @param reallyRender Only render this if true. Otherwise, just measure and return. @return the effective height after page breaking (may include some extra space above to push items onto the next page).

      • pageBreakingTopMargin

        float pageBreakingTopMargin(float bottomY,
                            float height)

        Returns the top margin necessary to push this item onto a new page if it won't fit on this one. If it will fit, simply returns 0.
